definition: winner/lucky guy/person who always gets good breaks
trusted/intimate/(of the emperor) to visit/variant of 幸[xing4]
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: Even the lucky ones in happy homes who have never felt my pain.
sentences.chinese: 即便是幸福家庭中的幸运儿也从未感受到我的痛苦。

sentences.english: Wheeldon is emphatically one of the lucky ones.
sentences.chinese: 惠尔登显然是那些幸运儿中的一个。

sentences.english: But only the fortunate few can say that.
sentences.chinese: 但是，只有少数的幸运儿可以这样说。

sentences.english: The surviving privileged members of S. T. A. R. S. were just the perfect bait.
sentences.chinese: 活下来的幸运儿们正好是完美的诱饵。

sentences.english: A few enviably lucky people met you here and there in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 一些让人嫉妒的幸运儿在上海的这里或那里遇见了你。

sentences.english: The victim got a boob job two years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这位令人不可思议的幸运儿于两年前接受隆胸手术。

sentences.english: The young girl is favoured by fortune.
sentences.chinese: 这年轻的姑娘是个幸运儿。

sentences.english: And fattened as on a decorous honey-comb.
sentences.chinese: 犹如在一个蜜蜂巢中长大的幸运儿。

sentences.english: Adema and Alamit are the lucky ones.
sentences.chinese: 阿迪马和阿拉米特都是幸运儿。

sentences.english: Yeah, you are right. But some lucky guys can make it come true.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，你是对的，但是一些幸运儿就可以。

sentences.english: Lucky Fellow and Unlucky Guy are neighbors and have been on good terms with each other.
sentences.chinese: 幸运儿和倒楣蛋是住在对门儿的好朋友。

sentences.english: I picked these shoes up dirt cheap. I am a lucky girl.
sentences.chinese: 这双鞋太便宜了，我真是个幸运儿。

sentences.english: John is a lucky dog, he just won 100 dollors on a bet.
sentences.chinese: 约翰真是个幸运儿，他与人打赌刚赢了100元。

sentences.english: The pet mascot even has her own office, a former ticket booth.
sentences.chinese: 这个幸运儿甚至有自己的办公室，先前的一个售票亭。

sentences.english: The researchers found that the capuchins treated the marmoset, who they named Fortunata, just like an infant capuchin.
sentences.chinese: 研究者们把这只狨猴取名为“幸运儿”。

definition: to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
to win (a prize in a lottery)
to have a lucky stroke/to try one's luck
to show appreciation for sb/to look upon sb with favor
